snippet: The fires, believed to have begun in Torres del Paine National Park last week, have also affected two other regions.
abstract: Chilean Pres Sebastian Pinera's government rejects accusations that it was slow in responding to wildfires that spread through unseasonably hot and dry parts of country.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and PASCALE BONNEFOY
byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro, and Pascale Bonnefoy from Santiago, Chile. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The fires, believed to have begun in Torres del Paine National Park last week, have also affected two other regions.

headline.seo: Piñera Defends Response to Chile Wildfires
headline.main: Chile’s President Defends His Response to Wildfires
headline.print_headline: Chile’s President Defends His Response to Wildfires

keywords.value: Torres del Paine National Park (Patagonia, Chile)
